intro: Pilosella ziziana, commonly known as the Zizania pilosella, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in meadows and grassy areas. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its botanical features make it a common sight in open, sunny habitats.
